question: Will OpenAI publicly release the full o3 model before March 28, 2025?
description:
*This question is part of the* [*Bridgewater Forecasting Contest*](https://www.metaculus.com/bridgewater/)*. To be eligible to win prizes in the competition you must register for the tournament. The last day to register is March 24, 2025. Sign up or check your registration status* [*here*](https://www.metaculus.com/bridgewater/)*.*

***

OpenAI announced its forthcoming o3 and o3-mini AI models in a [<u>livestream</u>](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SKBG1sqdyIU) on December 20, 2024. Described as a successor to o1 and skipping over o2, purportedly due to [<u>Telefonica’s O2</u>](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/O2_\(UK\)), OpenAI [<u>described</u>](https://finance.yahoo.com/news/openai-announces-o3-models-175657596.html) o3 as a significant breakthrough in AI reasoning. The model was reported to have significantly outperformed any previous AI system [<u>on coding and research-level math</u>](https://x.com/polynoamial/status/1870172996650053653?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1870172996650053653%7Ctwgr%5E16fa4771724238be9b30de71968a334c68bca7af%7Ctwcon%5Es1_\&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Ftechcrunch.com%2F2024%2F12%2F20%2Fopenai-announces-new-o3-model%2F), and also [<u>exceeded previous performance</u>](https://arcprize.org/blog/oai-o3-pub-breakthrough) on the [<u>Abstract and Reasoning Corpus for Artificial General Intelligence</u>](https://arcprize.org/arc) (ARC-AGI) challenge by far, even reaching approximately human level. According to ARC-AGI:

> Despite the significant cost per task, these numbers aren't just the result of applying brute force compute to the benchmark. OpenAI's new o3 model represents a significant leap forward in AI's ability to adapt to novel tasks. This is not merely incremental improvement, but a genuine breakthrough, marking a qualitative shift in AI capabilities compared to the prior limitations of LLMs. o3 is a system capable of adapting to tasks it has never encountered before, arguably approaching human-level performance in the ARC-AGI domain.
>  
> Of course, such generality comes at a steep cost, and wouldn't quite be economical yet: you could pay a human to solve ARC-AGI tasks for roughly \$5 per task (we know, we did that), while consuming mere cents in energy. Meanwhile o3 requires \$17-20 per task in the low-compute mode. But cost-performance will likely improve quite dramatically over the next few months and years, so you should plan for these capabilities to become competitive with human work within a fairly short timeline.

OpenAI also announced applicants could [<u>apply</u>](https://openai.com/index/early-access-for-safety-testing/) to help safety test forthcoming advanced models. In the announcement video, OpenAI CEO Sam Altman [<u>said</u>](https://www.youtube.com/live/SKBG1sqdyIU?si=_93eeXULrkrt8K_o\&t=1293):

> We plan to launch o3-mini around the end of January, and full o3 shortly after that, but . . . the more people can help us safety test the more we can make sure we hit that.
fine_print:
* An o3 version will be considered to be the “full” version if it does not have any qualifiers in its name or description that suggest that the version is not the full version.
  * For example “o3-mini” would not count, and neither would a model named “o3-preview” or described in the announcement or model description as a preview or otherwise not yet the full o3. Stated intentions to continue developing and improving the o3 model will **not** on their own result in the model being considered to not yet be the full version of o3.
  * Names or descriptions that suggest a variant form of a “full” version will be sufficient to resolve the question as **Yes**. For example, o3-pro would be sufficient, while different versions with low and high compute times would also count, for example “o3-low” or “o3-high”, so long as Metaculus assesses that their descriptions are compatible with being a variant of o3 full.
* It is immaterial if o3 is released with limited or restricted reasoning or compute times. For example, if o3 is released in a manner that satisfies these criteria but is only available in “low” compute mode or has similar restrictions, the question will still resolve as **Yes**.
* In the event OpenAI renames o3 to be something other than o3, this question will still resolve as **Yes** if OpenAI states that the model is the one formerly announced as o3 and all other criteria have been met.
* Metaculus will defer to statements made by OpenAI. For example, it will be immaterial if there is speculation that a released o3 model does not have the full capabilities described in previous announcements of o3.
* Releases of other models are immaterial. For example if GPT-5 is released and it is not publicly described by OpenAI as being o3, that will not be sufficient.
* The model will be considered publicly available via web interface if it is available on a webpage for users to interact and converse with, including if limited only to paid subscribers of a certain payment tier, and all of the following availability criteria also apply:
  * It must be available to users in the United States. Availability in other countries is not required.
  * It must not be subject to an invite-only waitlist, for example invite-only betas or testing periods are not sufficient. 
  * In the event of a gradual or phased rollout, or in the event access and signups are disabled due to high demand, the question will resolve as **Yes** if at least two Metaculus admins are able to access o3, on separate accounts, as described in these criteria before the date in question. Metaculus admins will not make excessive effort to check for access or to try to get access (aside from completing any signup or subscription steps needed to access o3), and will simply check periodically whether they can access o3.
  * Rate limits or usage restrictions on the number of messages allowed are immaterial, so long as at least one message and response can be had.
* Release of o3 via API without being released as a web interface is not sufficient.
news:
Here are the relevant news articles:

**OpenAI Opens ChatGPT Search Function to All Users, Raising Questions about Competition with DeepSeek**
OpenAI has announced that all users can access ChatGPT's search function without registration, but our test shows that this is still dependent on the user's location. The search function, which was released in November, allows the model to access the latest information by connecting to the internet. In contrast, Chinese models like Kimi have had this feature for a while, with Baidu claiming that 20% of its search results pages are generated by AI. OpenAI's move has raised questions about its relation to DeepSeek, a model that was released in January and has gained popularity. DeepSeek's open-source model has put pressure on OpenAI, which has responded by upgrading its free features, including the release of a new reasoning model called o3-mini. OpenAI's founder, Sam Altman, has said that the company will release an even better model, and the success of o3-mini will be crucial in maintaining its lead.
Original language: zh
Publish date: February 06, 2025 10:03 AM
Source:[k.sina.com.cn](https://k.sina.com.cn/article_1887344341_707e96d502001kyc4.html?from=tech)

**OpenAI, Microsoft and Google prove again, nothing's consistent in the world of AI**
OpenAI has released its o3-mini reasoning model, which is 24% faster than o1-mini and delivers more accurate answers. Microsoft has also integrated OpenAI's o1 reasoning model into Copilot users, without requiring an extra subscription. Apple's financial year has seen a December-quarter record, driven by robust sales across product lines. Apple CEO Tim Cook emphasized the company's focus on India, with plans to open four new Apple Stores this year. The Union Budget 2025 has allocated ₹500 crore for three AI Centres of Excellence and a Deeptech Fund of Funds, aiming to accelerate India's leadership in technology and AI. Industry experts have welcomed the budget's initiatives, including the establishment of AI Centres of Excellence in education and the push for AI-driven solutions in logistics and supply chain efficiency.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 06, 2025 01:44 AM
Source:[Hindustan Times](https://www.hindustantimes.com/technology/openai-microsoft-and-google-prove-again-nothing-s-consistent-in-the-world-of-ai-101738778907042.html)

**OpenAI Launches o3-mini Series Model for Free**
OpenAI has recently announced the release of its new o3-mini series model, which has sparked widespread attention in the industry. The o3-mini series model focuses on rapid reasoning capabilities, particularly excelling in coding and logical reasoning functions, providing users with more efficient and intelligent services. Notably, the o3-mini series model is not only available to paid users but also to the free user community, reducing the barrier for users to access advanced AI technology and promoting the popularization and application of AI technology. In terms of security, the o3-mini series model has also performed well, with its training data strictly filtered to ensure compliance with safety and regulatory requirements. Additionally, the model supports online search functionality, providing users with more comprehensive and accurate information services. Although the o3-mini series model has shown superior performance to o1 in multiple evaluations, it currently does not support multi-modal functions. However, as technology continues to advance and the model is optimized, it is expected to improve its functions and provide users with more comprehensive services. OpenAI has stated that they will continue to strive to improve the model's intelligence level and reduce the cost of obtaining the same level of intelligence, demonstrating their commitment to technological innovation and providing users with more expectations and possibilities.
Original language: zh
Publish date: February 05, 2025 09:53 PM
Source:[中关村在线](https://projector.zol.com.cn/946/9461115.html)

**OpenAI Releases o3-Mini Model and Deep Research Feature**
OpenAI has released a new version of its GPT model, o3-mini, which is a simplified version of its previous model, o3. The o3-mini model has a performance comparable to OpenAI's previous model, o1, and has a 24% faster response time. OpenAI has also released a new feature called 'Deep Research', which allows users to access online files and perform complex tasks such as graph creation and data visualization. The Deep Research feature has achieved a record-breaking 26.6% accuracy on the 'Human Last Exam' (HLE) test, surpassing the previous record held by DeepCirrus-R1. OpenAI is offering the o3-mini model to its Plus, Team, and Enterprise users, and will also provide it to its free users in the form of a 'Reason' option. The company is also considering making its source code open-source. The release of o3-mini and Deep Research is seen as a response to the emergence of DeepCirrus-R1, which has disrupted the market by offering a high-performance AI model at a 30th of the price of OpenAI's o1 model. OpenAI's move to make its models more accessible and affordable is part of a broader trend towards 'AI democratization', where AI technology is becoming more widely available and accessible to everyone.
Original language: ko
Publish date: February 05, 2025 08:22 AM
Source:[it.donga.com](https://it.donga.com/106505/)

**OpenAI Unveils New AI Upgrade: Faster, Smarter, and Free**
OpenAI has released a new AI upgrade, o3-mini, which is faster, smarter, and free for all users of its ChatGPT service. The model is optimized for math, programming, and natural sciences and provides a reasoning model for free users for the first time. According to OpenAI, o3-mini is 24% faster than its predecessor, o1-mini, and delivers the same or better quality in output. Additionally, the model has internet access, making results more current and accurate. OpenAI is responding to growing competition, particularly from DeepSeek-R1 and Alibabas Qwen 2.5 Max, by offering this upgrade. As for usage limits, OpenAI has not specified a exact number for free users, but Plus and Team users are limited to 150 messages per day. OpenAI's CEO said, 'With o3-mini, we're taking a significant step forward in making AI more accessible and powerful for everyone.' 
Original language: de
Publish date: February 04, 2025 07:25 PM
Source:[20 Minuten](https://www.20min.ch/story/chatgpt-neues-ki-upgrade-fuer-gratisnutzer-verfuegbar-103273615)

**OpenAI Releases DeepSeek Challenger Model OpenAI Releases DeepSeek Challenger Model OpenAI Releases DeepSeek Challenger Model**
OpenAI has released its latest AI model, o3-mini, designed to deliver advanced reasoning capabilities with enhanced speed and cost efficiency. The model is available through ChatGPT and the OpenAI API, with unlimited use for subscribers and usage limits for free plan users. O3-mini particularly targets science, technology, engineering and mathematics (STEM) applications, offering improved performance in areas such as math, coding and scientific problem-solving. In benchmark evaluations, o3-mini with medium reasoning effort matched the performance of the previous o1 model in math, coding and science tasks, while delivering faster responses and more accurate answers. According to OpenAI, the release of o3-mini marks another step in its mission to push the boundaries of cost-effective intelligence, making high-quality AI more accessible while maintaining top-tier reasoning capabilities.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 03, 2025 02:53 PM
Source:[aibusiness.com](https://aibusiness.com/generative-ai/openai-releases-deepseek-challenger-model)

**OpenAI o3-mini: A New Reasoning Model for STEM and Coding**
OpenAI has released OpenAI o3-mini, the latest and most affordable reasoning model in the series, now available in ChatGPT and the API. According to OpenAI, this powerful and fast model surpasses the limits of small-sized models, offering important STEM capabilities, particularly in science, mathematics, and coding, while maintaining the low cost and reduced latency of OpenAI o1-mini. OpenAI o3-mini is the first small-sized reasoning model from the company that supports the most requested features from developers, including function calling, Structured Output, and developer messages, making it ready for production immediately. As with OpenAI o1-mini and OpenAI o1-preview, o3-mini will support streaming. Developers can choose from three reasoning effort options - low, medium, and high - to optimize their specific use cases. This flexibility allows o3-mini to 'think more intensely' when facing complex challenges or prioritize speed when latency is a problem. However, o3-mini does not support vision capabilities, so developers should continue to use OpenAI o1 for visual reasoning tasks. OpenAI o3-mini is currently launching in the API Chat Completions, Assistants, and Batch for selected developers in API usage tiers 3-5. Users of ChatGPT Plus, Team, and Pro can already access OpenAI o3-mini, and Enterprise access will arrive in February. OpenAI o3-mini will replace OpenAI o1-mini in the model picker, offering higher speed limits and lower latency, making it a compelling choice for coding, STEM, and logical problem-solving activities. As part of this update, OpenAI is tripling the limit for Plus and Team users, increasing from 50 messages per day with o1-mini to 150 messages per day with o3-mini. Additionally, o3-mini now works with search to find updated answers with relevant web links. This is an initial prototype, notes the company, as the team is working to integrate search into its reasoning models. Free plan users can try OpenAI o3-mini by selecting 'Reason' in the message composer or regenerating a response.
Original language: it
Publish date: February 03, 2025 01:43 PM
Source:[01net.it](https://www.01net.it/openai-o3-mini-abbassa-i-costi-daccesso-al-modello-di-reasoning/)

**OpenAI Unveils o3-mini – This is What You Need Know**
OpenAI has released o3-mini, a new language model designed for cost-effective reasoning, available in ChatGPT and the API. This model excels in STEM fields like science, math, and coding, while maintaining low cost and reduced latency. o3-mini is a purpose-built reasoning model, optimized for tasks requiring logical deduction and problem-solving, particularly in technical domains. It supports developer-centric functionalities, including function calling, structured outputs, and developer messages, making it production-ready. The model also supports streaming, enabling dynamic and interactive experiences. According to OpenAI, o3-mini's performance is impressive, matching o1's performance in math, coding, and science, but delivering faster responses. Expert evaluations have shown that o3-mini produces more accurate and clearer answers with stronger reasoning abilities than o1-mini. OpenAI has also noted that o3-mini's performance extends across various benchmarks, including competition math, PhD-level science questions, and research-level mathematics. o3-mini is currently being rolled out in the Chat Completions API, Assistants API, and Batch API to select developers in API usage tiers 3-5.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 03, 2025 02:46 AM
Source:[techent.tv](https://techent.tv/2025/02/03/openai-unveils-o3-mini-this-is-what-you-need-know/)

**OpenAI Releases o3-mini, a STEM-Focused Reasoning Model**
OpenAI has released o3-mini, a new AI model that focuses on STEM capabilities, including coding, math, and science. The model supports highly requested developer features and offers three reasoning effort options—low, medium, and high—to optimize for specific use cases. o3-mini outperforms OpenAI's flagship model, o1, in some situations, especially within the STEM arena. Evaluations by expert testers showed that o3-mini produces more accurate and clearer answers, with stronger reasoning abilities, than OpenAI o1-mini. The model also delivers faster performance and improved efficiency, with responses 24% faster than o1-mini in A/B testing. OpenAI says its o1 models remains its flagship reasoning model, but o3-mini provides a specialized experience for those that need it.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 02, 2025 03:56 PM
Source:[webpronews.com](https://www.webpronews.com/openai-releases-o3-mini-a-stem-focused-reasoning-model/)

**OpenAI Unveils O3 Mini, a Free and Lightweight AI Model to Compete with DeepSeek**
OpenAI has launched O3 Mini, a free and lightweight AI model designed to provide enhanced accessibility and affordability for users worldwide. The model is optimized for faster response times, lower resource consumption, and broader availability, making it a direct competitor to emerging AI rivals like DeepSeek. According to OpenAI's official announcement, O3 Mini excels in logical reasoning tasks, outperforming earlier models on coding, problem-solving, and structured responses while being significantly more cost-effective. The model is available for free to ChatGPT users, with limited trials for premium features, and has been integrated into Microsoft Azure's OpenAI service, expanding its availability for developers and businesses.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 01, 2025 11:06 AM
Source:[technocodex.com](https://technocodex.com/openai-o3-mini-free-release/)

**OpenAI to Release Full Version of o3 Tomorrow**
OpenAI's Chief Global Affairs Officer Chris Lehane revealed in a recent interview that the full version of o3 will be released tomorrow (US time). This comes after OpenAI announced the next-generation model o3, with two versions: a formal o3 and a smaller o3-mini, in a 12-day online launch event last December. Only security researchers were allowed to register for access to the preview of o3 and o3-mini. However, OpenAI's Chief Product Officer Weil had previously hinted that o3 might be released in February or March this year. The sudden announcement of the full version of o3 may be a response to the recent hype around the open-source and 'affordable' Chinese large model DeepSeek-R1, which has topped the free app download charts in the Apple App Store in China and the US.
Original language: zh
Publish date: January 31, 2025 06:12 AM
Source:[新浪财经](https://finance.sina.com.cn/tech/roll/2025-01-31/doc-inehvyra1662616.shtml)

**OpenAI Unveils Next-Generation AI Models o3 and o3-mini**
OpenAI has announced the development of its new AI models, o3 and o3-mini, which have achieved unprecedented results in mathematical and scientific tests. According to Sam Altman, CEO of OpenAI, o3-mini will be released in late January 2025, followed by the full version of o3. These new models represent a significant evolution over their predecessors, highlighting their ability for 'simulated reasoning'. The o3 model has set new records in various benchmarks, including a 87.5% score in the ARC-AGI benchmark, equaling human performance, and a 96.7% score in the American Invitational Mathematics Examination 2024. OpenAI has also initiated a process for external researchers to test the o3 models before their public release, prioritizing security and thorough evaluation.
Original language: es
Publish date: December 23, 2024 11:00 PM
Source:[elorientaldemonagas.com](https://elorientaldemonagas.com/openia-proxima-generacion-de-ia-han-nacido-o3-y-o3-mini/)

**OpenAI unveils 'o3' reasoning AI models, plans roll out from January 2025**
OpenAI has announced the development of new reasoning AI models, o3 and o3 mini, which are currently in internal safety testing. According to CEO Sam Altman, the o3 mini model will be launched by the end of January 2025, with the full o3 model to follow. The o3 models are expected to be more powerful than OpenAI's previously launched o1 models, which were designed to tackle complex problems in science, coding, and math. OpenAI is also opening up an application process for external researchers to test the o3 models ahead of the public release, which will close on January 10. This move comes as OpenAI continues to compete with rivals such as Google in the AI technology race.
Original language: en
Publish date: December 23, 2024 08:13 AM
Source:[Business Standard](https://www.business-standard.com/technology/tech-news/openai-unveils-o3-reasoning-ai-models-plans-roll-out-from-january-2025-124122300414_1.html)

**OpenAI's New o3 Model to be Released in 2025: Low Cost, High Performance**
OpenAI CEO Sam Altman recently discussed the details of the upcoming o3 artificial intelligence model on YouTube. The model is expected to be released in 2025 and will surpass the performance of previous models. According to Altman, the o3-mini model, a smaller version of o3, will be released in January 2025, with the full o3 model to follow shortly after. The o3 model has already shown impressive results, achieving a 96.7% accuracy rate in the American Mathematics Competition, compared to the 83.3% rate of the previous model, o1. OpenAI Research Director Mark Chen stated, 'o3 usually only misses one question.' The company also used benchmark tests such as ARC-AGI to measure the model's performance, with o3 achieving a 87.5% success rate, surpassing the average human performance of 85%. Additionally, the o3-mini model, which uses Adaptive Thinking Time API, allows users to adjust thinking time and provides low computational costs while maintaining similar performance to the o1 model.
Original language: tr
Publish date: December 21, 2024 12:00 PM
Source:[tamindir.com](https://www.tamindir.com/haber/openai-yeni-nesil-o3-modeli-ozellikleri-cikis-tarihi_92021/)

**OpenAI's 12-Day 'Marathon' Live Broadcast: o3 Model Released**
OpenAI has completed its 12-day 'marathon' live broadcast, releasing the o3 model, the next generation of the o1 model. The o3 model focuses on reasoning ability and is a key product line of OpenAI, alongside the GPT series. The o3 mini version is expected to be released in January 2025, while the full version of o3 will be released later. OpenAI CEO Sam Altman stated that skipping the o2 name was to avoid conflict with the UK telecom operator O2. The o3 model has surpassed human-level performance in the AGI evaluation test ARC-AGI, with a score of 75.7 in 'low thinking mode' and 87.5 in 'high thinking mode'. The model's performance in programming competitions, such as Codeforces, has also been impressive, with a score of 2727, far surpassing the o1 model's score of 1891. In the AIME 2024 math competition, the o3 model achieved an accuracy rate of 96.7%, while the o1 model achieved an accuracy rate of 83.3%. OpenAI has also released the o3 mini version, which has a smaller model size and lower usage costs. The o3 mini model has three reasoning modes: low, medium, and high, allowing users to adjust the model's thinking time according to the complexity of the task. OpenAI has also announced that it will open up early access to security researchers, indicating its emphasis on AI security. Altman has also called on security researchers to apply for early access to help test the o3 mini and o3 models. 
Original language: zh
Publish date: December 21, 2024 10:35 AM
Source:[新浪财经](https://finance.sina.com.cn/roll/2024-12-21/doc-ineafmit1524789.shtml)

**Sam Altman-Run OpenAI Unveils o3 and o3-mini Models for Public Safety Testing, Likely To Launch in 2025; Check Details**
OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has announced the availability of two new AI models, OpenAI o3 and OpenAI o3-mini, for public safety testing. The o3 model achieved a 71.7% accuracy on the SWE-bench coding benchmark, surpassing the previous o1 model's performance. It also scored 96.7% on the AIME 2024 benchmark and 87.7% on the GPQA Diamond benchmark, showing significant improvements over its predecessor. The o3-mini model is a faster and optimized version of o3, focusing on coding tasks. These models are expected to be widely available by early 2025. 'These advanced models set new benchmarks in performance and accuracy across multiple domains,' according to OpenAI. 'These models offer improved performance and accuracy across various benchmarks and is likely to launch in 2025,' said Sam Altman. 
Original language: en
Publish date: December 21, 2024 08:18 AM
Source:[LatestLY](https://www.latestly.com/socially/technology/sam-altman-run-openai-unveils-o3-and-o3-mini-models-for-public-safety-testing-likely-to-launch-in-2025-check-details-6508032.html)

**OpenAI unveils new o3 and o3 mini models, to be launched next year**
OpenAI has unveiled its new frontier reasoning models, o3 and o3-mini, which will be launched next year. According to OpenAI CEO Sam Altman, the o3 mini will be released by the end of January, while the full o3 model will be launched later. The company is accepting applications from researchers to test the models before they are made public. The o3 model has reportedly outperformed its predecessors, excelling in coding tests by 22.8% and acing the AIME 2024 math contest with 87.7% scores. Altman stated, 'more robust LLMs could outperform existing models and lure new investors and users.' The new models are currently under internal safety testing and are expected to be more powerful than the o1 models, which are capable of reasoning through complex tasks. 'The o3 model has outdone the previous performance records set by its predecessors,' said Altman, adding that the model has 'excelled in coding tests, also known as SWE-Bench verified, by 22.8 per cent.'
Original language: en
Publish date: December 21, 2024 03:03 AM
Source:[indianexpress.com](https://indianexpress.com/article/technology/artificial-intelligence/openai-unveils-new-o3-and-o3-mini-models-to-be-launched-next-year-9737139/)

**OpenAI Announces New Model 'o3' with Improved Performance in Coding and Mathematics**
OpenAI has announced a new model, 'o3', which improves performance in coding and mathematics. This comes after the release of 'o1' in September, which was trained to think logically and reason. The new model, 'o3', has undergone safety testing with external researchers and is expected to be publicly available from January 2025 onwards. This is the final day of a series of announcements from OpenAI, which has been releasing new services over the past 12 days.
Original language: ja
Publish date: December 21, 2024 02:19 AM
Source:[朝日新聞デジタル](https://www.asahi.com/articles/ASSDP0JBJSDPUHBI007M.html?iref=ogimage_rek)

**OpenAI Previews Next-Generation Model 'o3', Scheduled for Early 2025 Release**
OpenAI has previewed its next-generation model 'o3' at the end of its '12 Days of Publishing' series. According to OpenAI CEO Sam Altman, the model was named 'o3' 'out of respect for Telefónica, and in keeping with OpenAI's tradition of being very, very bad at naming things.' o3 has shown significant improvements in performance compared to its predecessor o1. In a test where o3 was given the American Invitational Mathematics Examination (AIME) problems, it achieved a 96.7% accuracy rate, compared to o1's 83.3%. Mark Chen, senior vice president of research at OpenAI, said, 'This means o3 is usually only wrong once.' However, o3 is not yet available to the public, and will be first provided to researchers who want to help with security testing. The official release is expected to be sometime in early 2025. OpenAI also showcased o3-mini, a new model that uses the company's Adaptive Thinking Time API to provide three different reasoning modes. o3-mini is expected to be released in late January 2025, with o3 to follow shortly after.
Original language: zh
Publish date: December 21, 2024 02:09 AM
Source:[Yahoo News (Taiwan)](https://tw.news.yahoo.com/openais-next-generation-o3-model-will-arrive-early-next-year-020033002.html)

**OpenAI Announces New Model o3 with Significant Improvements**
OpenAI announced a new model, o3, which is set to be released in early 2024. The model is currently not available for public use, but will be made available to researchers for testing its security. The company also announced o3-mini, which is expected to be released in late January, and the full version of o3 will be released shortly after. The main feature of o3 is its significant improvement over its predecessor, o1. On the American math exam AIME, o3 achieved a 96.7% accuracy rate, compared to o1's 83.3%. This means that o3 typically makes only one mistake. The model performed well on standard tests, so the company had to create more complex tests, such as ARC-AGI, which evaluates the ability of AI to learn intuitively. According to the creators of the test, passing ARC-AGI would be a 'significant milestone on the path to artificial general intelligence.' o3 achieved a 75.7% score on ARC-AGI with low computational resources, and 87.5% with additional resources. OpenAI also demonstrated o3-mini with three reasoning modes (low, medium, and high) based on the recently announced Adaptive Thinking Time API. This allows users to regulate the time 'for thinking' before the model provides an answer. o3-mini can achieve the results of the current model o1 with significantly lower computational costs and will be available to users before the full version of o3.
Original language: ru
Publish date: December 21, 2024 12:00 AM
Source:[itoboz.com](https://itoboz.com/games/openai-anonsirovala-model-novogo-pokoleniya-o3-s-relizom-v-nachale-goda/)

**OpenAI Develops New AI Model 'o3' with Improved Math and Code Generation Capabilities**
OpenAI has announced the development of its new AI model, 'o3', which is expected to be released in January 2025. The model is an upgrade to the 'o1' model released in September 2024, and is said to have improved capabilities in solving mathematical problems and generating programming code. OpenAI has also developed a smaller version of the model, 'o3-mini', which prioritizes speed over performance. According to OpenAI, the o3 model has made significant advancements in its ability to solve complex mathematical problems and generate code. 'o3' is expected to be a major upgrade to the current AI models, and will likely have a significant impact on various industries and applications.
Original language: ja
Publish date: December 20, 2024 11:12 PM
Source:[日本経済新聞](https://www.nikkei.com/article/DGXZQOGN20EY20Q4A221C2000000/)

**OpenAI Releases Advanced Reasoning AI Model 'o3'**
OpenAI has released a new advanced reasoning AI model called 'o3', which is an upgraded version of their previous model 'o1'. The new model is designed to think before responding and can perform tasks such as reasoning and planning. According to OpenAI, 'o3' is more reliable than 'o1' in fields such as physics, science, and mathematics. In some cases, 'o3' is even comparable to general-purpose AI (AGI). The model can adjust its reasoning time, allowing users to set the operation time to 'low', 'medium', or 'high', with longer operation times resulting in better performance. OpenAI claims that 'o3' outperforms other models in benchmarks, including a 22.8% improvement in the SWE-Bench Verified benchmark and a score of 2727 on the Codeforces benchmark, surpassing the top 99.2% of engineers. The company plans to release 'o3' in January 2025, with a mini version 'o3 mini' to be released first. OpenAI's CEO, Sam Altman, said, 'We plan to release 'o3 mini' in late January and 'o3' soon after.' Some researchers will receive a preview of the model starting today. The release of 'o3' is expected to accelerate the competition with Google's 'Jenny 2.0' and Meta's 'Llama 4'.
Original language: ko
Publish date: December 20, 2024 10:51 PM
Source:[연합뉴스](https://www.yna.co.kr/view/AKR20241221012800091)

**OpenAI Unveils o3 and o3-mini: The Next Generation of Artificial Reasoning Models**
OpenAI has announced the development of its new artificial intelligence models, o3 and o3-mini, marking a significant advancement in the pursuit of creating more intelligent and capable AI systems. According to Sam Altman, CEO of OpenAI, o3-mini is set to be released at the end of January 2025, followed by the full version of o3. These new models represent a significant evolution over their predecessors, particularly in their ability for 'simulated reasoning'. The o3 model has set new records in various benchmarks, including a 'private thought chain' system that allows AI to pause and examine its internal dialogue before responding, simulating human-like reasoning more accurately. OpenAI has initiated a request process for external researchers to test the o3 models before their public release, with applications open until January 10, prioritizing security and thorough evaluation.
Original language: es
Publish date: December 20, 2024 09:14 PM
Source:[RPP noticias](https://rpp.pe/tecnologia/innovaciones/openai-lanza-o3-y-o3-mini-la-proxima-generacion-de-modelos-de-razonamiento-artificial-noticia-1605783)

**OpenAI Announces Next-Generation 'Reasoning' Models o3 and o3-mini**
OpenAI announced the next generation of 'reasoning' models, o3 and o3-mini, which are designed to think before responding to user queries. According to Sam Altman, CEO of OpenAI, the previous model, o1, was named with a deliberate omission of a digit 'out of respect for Telefonica (O2 brand) and the tradition of coming up with bad names.' The o3 model is trained to reason before responding, which results in a delay, but it provides a chain of reasoning and the final answer it considers most accurate. Users can adjust the thinking time, and the model's performance improves with more time. In the ARC-AGI test, o3 achieved a 87.5% result, which is considered 'human-level' at 85%. However, TechCrunch notes that these results should be taken with skepticism and await external testing. The models are not yet available to the public, but will be available for public safety tests. Altman announced that o3-mini will be released by the end of January 2025, followed by o3. OpenAI previously released a preview of o1 in September 2024, and a full version in early December, along with a ChatGPT Pro subscription with access to an 'exclusive' version.
Original language: ru
Publish date: December 20, 2024 06:47 PM
Source:[vc.ru](https://vc.ru/chatgpt/1720592-openai-o3)

**OpenAI's New Model o3: A Leap Towards AGI**
OpenAI has announced o3, a new 'frontier model' that can reason and solve complex puzzles with unprecedented performance for a generative AI. o3 will be available in ChatGPT in 2025 after security tests. The model is designed to excel in tasks such as code and mathematical problems, and is aimed at scientists rather than general users. According to OpenAI, o3 has broken several records in internal tests and is getting closer to human-like reasoning. o3 will enter a 'Public Safety Testing' phase today, allowing researchers and registered users to test it. OpenAI also announced o3-mini, a smaller version of the model, which will be available in three variants: low, medium, and high. The low version will be as fast as GPT-4o, while the high version will be 46 times slower.
